resources.string: Unable to delete language while in use. To delete, deselect check box.
To change language, slide finger on space bar.
To see more options, turn on predictive text.
Swipe keyboard horizontally to switch between letters and symbols.
Show a big character bubble when a key on a Qwerty keyboard is tapped.
Enable Predictive text to use Auto spacing.
Automatically insert a full stop by tapping the space bar twice.
Automatically capitalize the first letter of each sentence.
Show voice entry button on keyboard.
Complete recognition mode is not supported for this language.
To see advanced options, turn on handwriting.
Recommend complete words based on characters entered so far.
Type words by swiping between letters.
Enable Predictive text to use SwiftKey Flow.
Using SwiftKey Flow will disable cursor control
Slide your finger across the keyboard to move the text cursor.
Using cursor control will disable SwiftKey Flow
Flick upwards on a key to view symbols and alternative characters.
Move cursor by sliding finger across keyboard.
Using the pointing keyboard will turn off continuous input.
Display full screen handwriting in S Note and Messaging
Continuous input is unavailable. Predictive text has been disabled.
Using the keyboard swipe will turn off continuous input.
Using continuous input will turn off the keyboard swipe.
Show the handwriting pad when the S Pen is detected.
The handwriting pad is automatically displayed when the S Pen is detected. You can disable pen detection in keyboard settings
To change the language, swipe horizontally across the space bar.
Set your keyboard for use with one hand.
When one-handed operation is selected, you can adjust the Samsung keyboard by tapping the arrow buttons on either side.

When one-handed operation is selected, you can adjust the Samsung keyboard by tapping the arrow buttons on either side in Portrait mode. This feature is available on the dialing keypad, call screen, Calculator and unlock pattern screen.

When one-handed operation is selected, you can adjust the Samsung keyboard by tapping the arrow buttons on either side in Portrait mode. You can turn on or off this feature on the keyboard directly using pinch zoom.
This feature is available on the dialing keypad, call screen, Calculator, and unlock pattern screen.
Pinch close on keyboard area to change keyboard type.
Press and hold with two fingers, then drag to move keyboards
Split keyboard can be moved up and down, and floating keyboard can be moved anywhere.
If personalized data is turned on, Samsung keyboard can learn your writing style, from Facebook, Gmail, Twitter, Messaging, and Contacts, and offer predictions and corrections tailored to you.
Enter text by sliding finger across keyboard.
Tap any text field to open keyboard.
While using keyboard, the back button becomes the hide button. Tap the hide button to close keyboard.
Tap the mode button to toggle characters and symbols.
The language button will appear when two or more languages are selected. Tap the language button to change language. Press and hold the language button then select language on the pop-up.
If two or more languages are selected in keyboard settings, swipe the space key to switch between them.
Tap the text entry field while the keyboard is open to make the handle appear.
Move the handle to the target destination to move the cursor.
Tap Select word or Select all to start text selection mode.

A cursor handle consists of a starting handle and an ending handle. Move both handles to select text. Release the handle to select copy, cut, paste and other options. Tap the handle to stop text selection.
Tap the keyboard icon on the notification panel to change the input method.
Tap and hold the multi-mode icon to choose between voice, handwriting, clipboard, and keyboard settings. Voice is the default selection
Tap and hold the multi-mode icon to choose between voice, clipboard, and keyboard settings. Voice is the default selection
Press and hold the multi-mode icon to choose between voice, handwriting, and keyboard settings. Keyboard setting is the default selection.
Press and hold the Customizable key to select voice, handwriting, clipboard, keyboard settings, emoticons, or the keyboard type.
Press and hold the voice key to select handwriting modes, clipboard and keyboard settings
Press and hold the voice button to select voice, Handwriting mode, the clipboard, keyboard settings, or to change keyboard.
Press and hold the voice button to choose between voice settings, the clipboard, and keyboard settings.
Press and hold the voice button to select voice, the clipboard, keyboard settings, or to change keyboard.
Tap the voice icon to use the voice function.
Tap the handwriting icon to use the handwriting function.
Tap the text recognition icon to use text recognition.
Tap the clipboard button to open the clipboard.
Tap the emoticon icon to insert emoticons.
Tap the settings icon to open the Samsung keyboard settings.
Zoom in on keyboard area with two fingers to change keyboard type.
Move split-screen keyboard and floating keyboard via multi-touch. Split-screen keyboard can be moved up and down, and floating keyboard can be moved anywhere.
Tap the keyboard icon on the status bar to change input method.
Tap the settings button to open Settings menu for Samsung QWERTY keypad. Press and hold the settings button to change input method.
Press and hold the customizable key to select voice, handwriting, clipboard, keyboard settings, and punctuation marks.
Press and hold the customizable key to select voice, handwriting, the clipboard, keyboard settings, or punctuation marks, or to change keyboard.
Press and hold the customizable key to choose between voice settings, the clipboard, keyboard settings, and punctuation marks.
Press and hold the customizable key to select voice, the clipboard, keyboard settings, punctuation marks, or to change keyboard.
Press and hold the customizable key to select voice, handwriting, text recognition, clipboard, keyboard settings, and punctuation marks.
Press and hold the customizable key to select voice, handwriting, text recognition, the clipboard, keyboard settings, punctuation marks, or to change keyboard.
Press and hold the customizable key to select voice, text recognition, clipboard, keyboard settings, and punctuation marks.
Press and hold the customizable key to select voice, handwriting, text recognition, clipboard, keyboard settings, punctuation marks, or the change keyboard icon.
Tap the change icon to switch between using the floating and normal keyboards.
Tap the Change icon to choose between the Qwerty, floating, and split keyboards.
Keyboard settings, except the my word list and the auto substitution list, will be reset.
Keyboard settings, except personalized data, will be reset.
Keyboard settings except personalized data and downloaded languages will be reset.

1. When you have written one character, write the next one. Write each letter to the right of the previous character. If you draw a stroke on top of a previous character, it may be recognized as a new character.
3. Do not write characters on top of one another.
When writing more than one line, make sure you leave enough space.

4. Most of the languages can recognize not only individual characters, but characters written together that make up words. (This is referred to as supporting words and phrases.) The languages that do and do not support words and phrases should be listed in this guide.
(All languages which support Handwriting SIP should support words and phrases)
Languages that support words and phrases
Supporting recognition of words and phrases
5. In some languages, cursive writing can be recognized. (Cursive writing recognition)
For languages in which cursive writing is recognized, connected character writing should also be recognized.
For languages in which cursive writing is not recognized, characters should be written separately.
Languages that do and do not support cursive writing should be listed in this guide.

"Languages that support cursive writing: English UK, English US, Dansk, Deutsch, Español, Suomi, Français, Italiano, Norsk, Nederlands, Português, Svenska
Languages that do not support cursive writing: Čeština, Български, Ελληνικά, Eesti, Hrvatski, Magyar, íslenska, Қазақ, 한국어, Lietuvių, Latviešu, Polski, Română, Русский, Slovenčina, Slovenščina, Srpski, Türkçe, Українська
E.g. A language that supports cursive writing: English
E.g. A language that does not support cursive writing: 한국어"
Languages that do not support cursive writing
A language that supports cursive writing, e.g., English
A language that does not support cursive writing, e.g., 한국어
You can only enter handwriting in the drawing panel when the recognition type is set as complete recognition.
Not enough space in device storage. Delete some files and try again.
Maximum number of supported languages (%d) reached.
Language list updated. %d new languages added.
Language list updated. 1 new language added.
Language list updated. No new languages added.

"Samsung keyboard can store all of the text you enter, including personal data and credit card numbers, except passwords, in order to give better prediction results. Continue?
If you do not want your personal data to be stored, go to keyboard settings and turn off personalized data."
Samsung keyboard can learn entered text to enhance auto replacement and provide better prediction results. This excludes security information, such as passwords and credit card numbers.

"Samsung keyboard can store all of the text you enter, except passwords and numbers, in order to give better prediction results. Continue? If you do not want your personal data to be stored, go to keyboard settings and turn off personalized data."
‘%s’ will be removed from learned words.
Turning on Personalized data will allow the Samsung keyboard to use the personal language data you have entered to improve your prediction results. Tap OK to turn on Personalized data.
To turn off this function later, go to Settings > Language and input > Samsung keyboard settings.

A new language is now available. Update your language list by downloading the new language. Tap OK to update now. You can also update by tapping the More button and selecting Update. Note that downloading via mobile networks may result in additional charges depending on your payment plan.
Connecting to mobile networks may result in additional charges.
Log in to Facebook to let your device learn your writing style.
Log in to Gmail to let your device learn your writing style.
Log in to Twitter to let your device learn your writing style.
Update to allow your device to learn your messaging style.
Update to allow your device to learn your Contacts style.
Complete or replace the word you are typing with the most probable word when you tap the space bar or a punctuation mark.
Complete or replace the word you are typing with the most probable word when you tap the space bar.
To turn on Auto replace, select at least one language.
Enable Predictive text to use Auto replacement.
Auto replace in Korean only available while using Qwerty keyboard.
Set your phone to update your predictive text with popular new words every week.
Set your phone to use the personal language data you have entered to improve your prediction results.
To update your language data, you need to connect to a network. Connecting via Mobile data may result in additional charges depending on your payment plan.
Set your phone to suggest emoji based on the characters you have entered.
"Personalization services are provided by a third party service provider. Service provider's Privacy Policy is applied."
Your remote data has been cleared.
Failed to personalize keyboard using %1$s. Try again.
Failed to clear your remote data. Try again.
Your personal language data has been cleared.
Error occurred while clearing your personal language data. Try again.
Failed to personalize keyboard using %1$s. Try later.
You need to register a Google account to download Facebook.
Unable to personalize data. You are not connected to mobile networks. Connect to a Wi-Fi network instead.
Data submitted. Check notifications to see when personalization is complete.
As of %1$s, you had no messages to learn from. Tap to learn again.
As of %1$s, you had no contacts to learn from. Tap to learn again.
Data successfully learned %1$s. Tap to learn again.
Last attempt failed %1$s. Tap to try again.
Last attempt failed. Tap to try again.
The servers are currently busy. Try later.
Clear all personalized language data collected to learn your writing style.
If you continue, you will lose everything that Samsung keyboard has learned about your writing style, including any new words you have used. Continue?
Enter text by dragging your finger through all the letters in a word instead of tapping.
Tap and hold the multi-mode icon to choose between voice, handwriting, clipboard, and keyboard settings. Voice is the default selection
Press and hold the voice button to select Handwriting mode, text recognition, the clipboard or keyboard settings, or to change keyboard.

The keyboard learns the words and phrases you use most often, making typing easier and improving accuracy over time. You can personalize word prediction by syncing with your Gmail, Facebook, Twitter or blogs.
Press and hold unwanted words in the predicted text box to remove them from the database.
Wi-Fi network is not available. Connecting to mobile networks may incur additional charges depending on your payment plan.
Using mobile data when roaming will incur extra charges.
The selected languages support handwriting recognition. Tap Settings to set a handwriting recognition language.
The handwriting recognition language has been changed to %s. Tap Settings to change the handwriting recognition language.
Tap to keep the current text, or tap the space key to accept the predicted correction.
Touch and hold to view a list of symbols and options, then select one to assign as a shortcut.
Tap and hold this key to access a list of keyboard settings.
Press and hold this key to access a list of keyboard settings.
To use the keyboard easily with one hand, touch and hold this key, then select %s to turn on One-handed operation. You can also view the symbol list and assign shortcuts to symbols.
Swipe the space bar left or right to change language.
Double tap to change the input language.
To customize the tap and hold delay, tap and hold the box below, then release after the desired length of time. Tap Save to apply your changes.
Assign text shortcuts to number keys. This function is only available when using Qwerty keyboards.
Assign text shortcuts to the number keys.
Go to Settings > Language and input > Samsung keyboard settings > My hot keys to assign a shortcut to a number key.
Shortcut text changed for number %d key.
Only text can be assigned to number keys.
Unable to enter characters using the dial button while input method is set as touch. Switch input method to dial button?
Unable to enter characters using touch input while input method is set as the dial button. Switch input method to touch?
This application is not supported in restricted profiles.
